sen.j: 清原 夏野（きよはら の なつの、延暦元年(782年) - 承和 (日本)4年10月7日 (旧暦)（837年11月12日））は平安時代初期の貴族、政治家。
sen.e: KIYOHARA no Natsuno (782-November 12th 837) was the nobility and a politician in the early Heian Period.
KIYOHARA no Natsuno (782 - November 12, 837) was of the nobility and a politician in the early Heian period.

tit.cmt: 用語統一リストにあわせました。

sen.j: 舎人親王の孫小倉王の第5王子として生まれ、初めの名乗りを繁野王といった。
sen.e: He was born as the fifth prince of Prince Ogura, a grandchild of Imperial Prince Toneri, and called Prince Shigeno at first.
He was born as the fifth prince of Prince Ogura, a grandchild of Imperial Prince Toneri, and was initially called Prince Shigeno.

sen.j: 延暦23年（804年）、父の小倉王の上表により清原真人姓を賜り臣籍降下、後世に続く清原氏の始祖となる。
sen.e: Following his father Prince Ogura instruction, he left the Imperial family to be a subject after having received a name of KIYOHARA no Mahito in 804 and became the founder of the Kiyohara family, which continued for long.

Following the instructions of his father, Prince Ogura, he left the Imperial Family and became subject after having received the name KIYOHARA no Mahito in 804; he became the founder of the Kiyohara family, which ultimately developed a long history.

Following the instructions of his father, Prince Ogura, he received the name KIYOHARA no Mahito in 804 and demoted from nobility to subject, becoming the founder of the Kiyohara clan, which continued for generations.

sen.j: 位階は従二位、官職は右大臣まで昇進。
sen.e: He was awarded the Court rank of Junii (Junior Second Rank), and promoted to the Udaijin (minister of the right).

sen.j: 平安京右京の双岡（ならびがおか、双ヶ丘）に山荘を営んだことから双岡大臣と称されたほか、比大臣、北岡大臣、野路大臣などと、幾通りもの呼び名をもって知られた。
sen.e: While he was called "Narabi-ga-oka daijin (minister)" because he lived in a mountain villa at Narabi-ga-oka, Ukyo Heian-kyo (west part of ancient capital in current Kyoto), he was also called in various ways such as "Hi daijin", "Kitaoka daijin", "Noji daijin".

sen.j: 学識の高さや政治・経済に対する確かな見識をもって朝廷・民間双方からの信任が篤かった。
sen.e: With his great scholarship and accurate discernment to the politics and economy, he won the confidence of both Imperial court and private organization.

sen.e: He also constructed the Uozumi no tomari (Uozumi port) in Harima Province using his own funds in 832.

sen.j: また、翌天長10年（833年）には、淳和天皇の勅に従い菅原清公らとともに令義解を編纂し、日本法制史にも大きな足跡を残している。
sen.e: Moreover, following Emperor Junna's order, he compiled "Ryo no gige (clarification of Code)" with SUGAWARA no Kiyokimi and others, which contributed much to Japan's legal history.
